Default Alias: %s

WikiMarkup

URL will display
http://something/report.dll?export%3FFF1142 - This URL fails

Uploading empty jar plugin causes NullPointerException

fields.description: We have one index on the ATTACHMENTDATA table called attch_data_idx. But this index only covers the ATTACHMENTID column. But the only query apart from primary key queries we run against that table uses the ATTACHMENTID *and* the ATTVERSION as a selection criteria. This query will not use the single column index and we therefore need compound index which includes ATTACHMENTID and ATTVERSION.
fields.summary: Compound database index missing for ATTACHMENTDATA table

fields.description:
saveOrUpdate is synchronized, but makes database calls with no timeouts.
This means that if the query is slow or hangs, Confluence will gradually run out of database connections as the first call will never release the lock.

Setting version to 2.7, but probably affects older versions.
fields.summary: HibernateConfluenceBandanaRecordDao's saveOrUpdate can consume all database connections

fields.description:
The following foreign key constraint error is thrown when trying to remove a space:
{noformat}
org.springframework.dao.DataIntegrityViolationException: Hibernate operation: could not delete: [com.atlassian.confluence.pages.Attachment#131179]; SQL []; ERROR: update or delete on table "attachments" violates foreign key constraint "fk9dc3e34d34a4917e" on table "attachmentdata"
  Detail: Key (attachmentid)=(131179) is still referenced from table "attachmentdata".; nested exception is org.postgresql.util.PSQLException: ERROR: update or delete on table "attachments" violates foreign key constraint "fk9dc3e34d34a4917e" on table "attachmentdata"
  Detail: Key (attachmentid)=(131179) is still referenced from table "attachmentdata".
Caused by: org.postgresql.util.PSQLException: ERROR: update or delete on table "attachments" violates foreign key constraint "fk9dc3e34d34a4917e" on table "attachmentdata"
  Detail: Key (attachmentid)=(131179) is still referenced from table "attachmentdata".
{noformat}
This problem only occurs when attachments are stored in the database and a custom logo is configured for the space. This problem will be more evident in a cluster as attachments are always stored in the database.
fields.summary: Error removing space with custom space logo and attachments stored in the database

fields.description:
The DefaultThumbnailManager acquires an InputStream for attachment data but never closes it.

This causes issues when transferring attachments from a draft to a page, as the attachment is still locked by confluence. This will occur mostly on linux and windows boxes as Mac OSX does not check for open streams.
fields.summary: InputStream not closed after thumbnail generation

The problem was fixed in version 2.4.1.   http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/CONFEXT/Confluence+User+Lister+Plugin

When the bundled plugin jar is opened we can see that the old version of the Userlister plugin is included 2.4 and not the fixed version. The most recent version is 2.4.2

Hi there, it just started about a couple of weeks ago.  I can not view any of the images embedded on any pages anymore. All I see is small box with a X through it.  I tried to view the page in both IE & Firefox with no luck.  when I click on the attachment tab and then trying to access the image file directly, I've got the following error message:
===============
You do not have permission to access /download/attachments/13173563/EDI_DTP_Add_v2.jpg. To access this page, please log in as a user with sufficient permissions.
===============

btw, I also can not see the chart in the Global Activity screen neither.

The weird thing is, I have full administrator rights and none of my co-wokers are having this problem.  so I don't know what else could cause this to happen to me only?


please help.

thanks

Ming

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-13803].
  {panel}

Hi,

Here are the steps to create a page from a template which uses a scaffolding macro in order to get a form:
* Add page
* Name the page
* Select a template
* {color:red} Save the code to access to the form (I want this step transparent for my clients){color}
* Fill the form
* Save the page

Using a parameter (maybe when you create the template) , I would like to be able to automatically save the code coming from the template. 
In this way, my clients have a straight acces to the form they have to fill and the forth step is not visible and so they can not see the code.

Thanks and regards,
Stephane
fields.summary: Save automatically the code coming from a template

fields.summary: External group with a comma or a slash does not work on page restriction

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-13798].
  {panel}

Currently the upgrade process checks the build ID against confluence.cfg.xml to see whether the user is trying to upgrade. In addition, the build number stored in the database should be checked to prevent problematic upgrades.

Customers might inadvertently do the following while trying to upgrade Confluence:

# Install latest version distribution
# Create new database
# Run through setup wizard
# Restore sql dump from old version

The procedure is completely broken because it loses all information stored in the home directory (such as attachments), but Confluence doesn't currently do anything to prevent it.

At the moment, the upgrade process does not start because the home directory version number (in confluence.cfg.xml) matches the build number stored in the application itself. The application starts up with the old data, and with a reindex it can look as if Confluence is mostly working. Only much later can the failure of some operation with the home directory data expose the upgrade as a complete disaster.

If the upgrade process also checked the version number stored in the database and stopped Confluence starting if the home directory and database didn't match, it would make this situation easier to diagnose and prevent customers using Confluence after such a failed upgrade.
fields.summary: Prevent Confluence startup if version of home directory and database do not match (to stop inadvertent attempt to upgrade via database backup)

fields.description:
Index searcher not properly closed after searches, because com.atlassian.bonnie.search.LuceneSearcher.searchCount(Query, Filter) does not trigger a close() call on the index.
This can lead to unreleased file handles on certain operating system and file system combinations (e.g. Linux/ext3).

fields.description:
Currently when Confluence is running in a clustered mode the only storage option for attachments is database.

While it might be a convenient solution to get a cluster up a running quickly, putting extra strain on the db can quickly result into performance problems as many Confluence admins have seen in the past.

An ideal solution would be to add support for NAS/SAN filesystems which would be shared by all the cluster nodes.

I understand that it might not be easy for some to set up an appropriate filesystem, but on the other hand, when someone wants to run a confluence cluster he/she usually has the skills and resources available for setting up a shared filesystem.
fields.summary: Support network file system as an attachment storage option for Confluence cluster

fields.description:
If an indexed attachment is very large, then rendering the search results page is quite slow.  

- *Example* - In this instance, the attachments were a pair of Excel documents that were each larger than 5 megs.  
- *Mitigation:* - These documents did not need to be indexed, so I replaced the user's attachments with zipped versions of the documents.

*Recomendation*

It would be nice if there was a test and whatever process is actually taking so long was skipped for these large documents, so that server time is not wasted when searching for any word that appears in this large document.  My guess is that the time is spent rendering the context lines, but the profiling output isn't that detailed.
fields.summary: Rendering search results very slow if source document is large in Confluence 2.8.2
[Remote API] Unable to move a page from space to space.
double opt-in feature in Confluence

fields.description: The page tree views in Confluence should be better handled for very large, flat spaces. We should have a maximum limit of pages displayed as it is quite unusable to have a tree of 1000 pages displayed and expect the user to drag and drop within such a large tree.
fields.summary: Tree View should limit the number of pages displayed

fields.description:
textfield-and-picker.vm is expecting the parameter 'actionName' in order to decide what type of group search is required. However, actionName is clashing with ConfluenceActionSupport.getActionName() which means the default group search is not being used.

In 2.10 a new parameter 'groupSeachActionName' was introduced to avoid clash. In 3.0 we should remove the old parameter completely.
fields.summary: Remove actionName from textfield-and-picker velocity parameters

fields.description:
See here for the issue with the IBM VM: http://www.ibm.com/developerworks/forums/thread.jspa?messageID=14145018

Apache XMLRPC (we use v2.0) reuses a StringBuffer. This causes serious problems, because the buffer size increases, and does not return to a sane size. This, coupled with a bug with the IBM VM causes us to see a large amount of ~2MB Strings while running functional tests.

Fixing this by patching XMLRPC to alloc a new StringBuffer instead of reusing.
fields.summary: Apache XMLRPC reuses StringBuffer - causes problems with IBM VM
Default panel background colour does not apply in PDF export

1. Edit a page in Firefox (this affects both FF 2 & 3)

3. type something
4. switch to wiki markup and you'll see something like:
{noformat}
h2. This is a heading

h2.
{noformat}
The last heading shouldn't be there. This is not a problem when you type the select the heading.
fields.summary: Creating headings in the RTE & Firefox causes empty headings also be created

fields.description:
The 404 page is undecorated (see {{decorators.xml}}) and should have a title element which is the i18n key {{title.404}}.

The acceptance test {{UserProfileAcceptanceTest.testNonExistentProfileRedirectsTo404()}} asserts that the page title is actually something of the pattern {{title.404 - <siteTitle>}}. This is wrong yet passes on all of our different builds.

If you hit the 404 page yourself you'll see that the page only has the {{title.404}} String and not the site title. The above acceptance test run against WebLogic is the same and therefore the test fails.

The question is, why does it pass in our normal acceptance test runs?
fields.summary: UserProfileAcceptanceTest.testNonExistentProfileRedirectsTo404 passes on some webservers with some clients but shouldn't

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-13770].
  {panel}

Today I had a very strange problem. The LDAP bind account got locked out. Users were editing the pages at the time, but, I gather, were not notified that there was a problem in saving drafts, and continued to enter information. In diagnosing the problem we restarted the server, and users promptly got a login page, loosing their content.

What I am asking is, under this scenario, would a user editing a page be informed that the draft was not saved? I know for sure that in this situation that the draft is not saved, as users lost data.

If such a notification is not made, can I suggest that this is a bug in the Draft handling which should know about anything that would stop the saving of the Draft....

Yes its a remote use case, yes it shouldn't happen, but it did.
fields.summary: Drafts can be lost if the underlying LDAP bind account gets disabled (no warnings issued to users so they keep typing...)

fields.description:
# Add a page, and enter some text
# Wait for the page to be saved as a draft, or force a draft save by navigating away
# Add a new page - there will be a message about having an unsaved draft. Ignore it.
# Enter text into the new page
# Preview
# Click discard while still on the preview tab.  All current text is lost.
fields.summary: Discarding a draft from the Preview tab will remove all information from the current page

fields.description:
In com.atlassian.confluence.pages.persistence.dao.FileSystemAttachmentDataDao.moveAttachment(Attachment, Attachment, ContentEntityObject) we use com.atlassian.core.util.FileUtils.moveDir(File, File) to move the attachments to the new destination. But we never check the return value of moveDir() which may result in the metadata being updated but the file not being moved.
We should throw an exception if the file couldn't be successfully moved, to rollback any changes to the attachment metadata.
fields.summary: Moving attachments may silently fail to move the actual file

fields.description:
{favpages} macro will show any pages labelled with 'favourite' when no user is logged in.

This means that when anonymous access is granted, an anonymous user can label pages, and have them show up as favourites on the dashboard for all anonymous users.

To see this in action, visit http://confluence.atlassian.com/dashboard.action. When not logged in, you get a list of "Favourite Pages".
fields.summary: Pages can be added to favourites list for anonymous users
Provide recommendations for memory management

fields.description: If you try to add a child page to a page which you can't view (see CONF-9374), the page tree will not be able to load. This means that the user is not able to edit or change the location of the page to something more reasonable.
fields.summary: Unable to change the location of a page with a restricted parent

fields.description: Changes made in the Admin area of the system are infrequent but important. The default logging level should be INFO rather than WARN, and INFO-level messages added to suitable actions. There is a longer-term plan for a complete admin-auditing solution but for now adding a few log lines is low cost.
fields.summary: Improve logging of global theme admin action

fields.description:
Create a new page named "Upgrade Notes Summary" that lists all the notes for all versions. (Consider doing it for *major* versions only.)

Then we could link to that page  from the general Upgrading notes (http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Upgrading+Confluence+Standalone+Edition).  

At the moment it seems easy to miss the upgrade notes for the releases, but they contain very important information.
fields.summary: Create a page which lists all upgrade notes for all versions

fields.description:
The decorator page layouts for some of the documentation spaces are customised, to show the left-hand pagetree navigation panel.

Because of the custom decorator, the new Confluence 2.10 decorator is not applied. This causes GUI problems --- in particular with this upgrade to 2.10, the new Quick Nav function does not work at all in the affected spaces.

Fix: Apply the Default Page Layout, then re-insert the custom code.

Apply the fix to the spaces on CAC as listed below. See instructions:
http://extranet.atlassian.com/display/TECHWRITING/Fixing+pagetree+nav+on+CAC+Confluence+upgrade

*Sarah:*
* All DOC and CONFxx spaces
* All CROWD and CROWDxx spaces
* APPLINKS
* DEVNET
* IDEPLUGIN
* CSH
* EHOSTING
* PLUGINFRAMEWORK and PLUGINFRAMEWORK20
* SAL
* ATLAS


*Andrew:*
* All BAMBOO and BAMBOOxx spaces
* JIRA
* JIRASTUDIO

*Ed:*
* All FISHEYE and FISHEYExx spaces
* All CRUCIBLE and CRUCIBLExx spaces
* All CLOVER and CLOVERxx spaces
fields.summary: Upgrade the decorator page layouts in all doc spaces that use left-hand nav
HibernateGroupManager.hasExternalMembership() is slow for group with thousands of users

fields.description:
If I look at my "Recent News", I see all my news items.
However, when I use the blog-posts macro, only some of the items show up.
If I have 6 entries, it is skipping entries 1 and 3.
fields.summary: News items show up in archive, but not in blog-posts macro

fields.description:
I moved a child-page with inherited permission from a restricted parent to an unrestricted parent within the tree view in Browse > Pages (listpages-dirview.action)

When looking at the restrictions in edit-mode of the page in the original location, confluence displays a warning that restriction is inherited.
When looking at the restrictions in edit-mode of the page in the new, moved location, no warning or restriction is displayed. 

Never the less, I still cannot access the page ("You cannot access this page due to inherited restrictions") even though there is no restriction on the page's new parent!
fields.summary: Bug when moving restricted pages
Default max size in recently-updated does not correspond to docs

fields.description:
In Confluence 2.10, [CONF-7395] is fixed, but there is a broken edge case:

Pasting internal Confluence links from Confluence pages into the Rich Text Editor breaks.

To reproduce:

1)copy the text from this page: http://qa-eac.atlassian.com/confluence/display/BUGS/pasting+links

The wiki markup is:

text [link|BUGS:Home] text

2) add a new page, and paste the copied text into the RTE.

3) switch to wiki markup. The pasted link is no longer valid:

text [link|../display/BUGS/Home] text


Apparently, TinyMCE cleverly constructs a relative URL instead of an absolute one.  This is not something handled well by the link resolver.  We need to either fix the link resolver to handle relative URLs, or find a switch in TinyMCE to turn off the relative URL behaviour, or *alter* TinyMCE to not modify the links.
fields.summary: Rich Text Editor does not handle copying and pasting links in the same domain

fields.description:
There is a known issue for MSSQL Server when [delegating Confluence user management to JIRA logins|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Delegate+user+management+to+use+JIRA+logins]:

* [Delegating user management to use Jira logins does not function (Invalid Username or Password)|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/KB/CSP-19533+-+Delegating+user+management+to+use+Jira+logins+does+not+function+(Invalid+Username+or+Password]

It would be helpful and more informative if MSSQL Server users can be warned on this before they proceed with the steps provided.
fields.summary: Add known issue for MSSQL Server in "Delegate user management to use JIRA logins" page

AdminAcceptanceTest#testOnlyASubsetOfTheAdministrationConsoleIsShownToConfluenceAdmins will fail because of this problem.

Don B reports -
Yes, this is an issue with Spring DM and WebLogic, apparently. The issue looks very similar to http://www.eclipsezone.com/eclipse/forums/m92036709.html The solution in that thread is to bundle an XML parser in the plugin, but I think a better solution would be to have confluence export that package in its package scanner configuration - weblogic.*

This fix didn't seem to work.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-13747].
  {panel}

When an LDAP repository is down, the message "group not found" appears next to local (hibernate) groups in the Administration > Global Permissions page. 

To replicate:
1) configure LDAP successfully
2) Shut down LDAP repository
3) Clear cache
4) View Administration > Global Permissions

The UI should show a more diagnostic message like "LDAP repository unavailable", not an error message for internal groups.

The internal groups work in this scenario - it appears to be just a problem in the UI.
fields.summary: Handle LDAP repository outage and "group not found" message in global permissions
Switching to Rich Text corrupts links that use the color macro

fields.description: ImportLongRunningTask requires minor refactoring that could conceivably break external usage and therefore should occur after the 2.10 release.
fields.summary: Avoid using ContainerManger.getComponent in ImportLongRunningTask

fields.description:
When doing a site import, there is an option to do a reindex.  In a clustered environment one would expect a reindex on every node.  Until such a reindex occurs the index on other nodes will be completely inconsistent with the database and search results will be wrong.

It's easily worked around by performing a manual reindex on each node.
fields.summary: Confluence does not reindex the whole cluster after a site import

fields.description:
If the acceptance tests are running on a different machine from the test server then test that need to talk to the SMTP server will fail.

Greenmail 1.3 doesn't pass the javax.mail.Session the {{host.name}} parameter meaning that localhost is always assumed.

See {{GreenMailUtil#getSession}}. It creates {{Properties}} to be used in {{Session.getSession(props)}} but does not include the {{host.name}}.

We'll probably need to patch and release a new internal GreenMail version. I see no later version and no issues for this problem in their issue tracker.
fields.summary: GreenMail needs to be patched to support a mail server on different machine from test server
PNG files should get image icon in attachment listing

fields.description:
See: [http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Web+Resource+Plugins#WebResourcePlugins-WebResourceContexts]
See: CONF-13079

If you define your own web-resource context, you can't specify dependencies.  This means you can end up with your resources being loaded before jquery and/or atlassian.js.  This means you don't all the dependencies to do anything useful.

bq. org.postgresql.util.PSQLException: ERROR: relation with OID 4024106 does not exist

The workaround for this issue is to use Confluence's built-in C3P0 connection pool (configured when [setting up Confluence initially|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Confluence+Setup+Guide], or via confluence.cfg.xml), which does not experience this problem.

Upgrading to PostgreSQL 8.3 may potentially fix the problem (as suggested by [this PostgreSQL FAQ entry|http://www.postgresql.org/docs/faqs.FAQ.html#item4.19]), but this has not been tested by Atlassian.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-13715].
  {panel}

This is a feature request to allow page titles to be part of a page template. This would allow template creators to enforce a standard page title in a format required. For example, they might want to enforce a title of 

CR-XXX XXXXXXXX

Where X is a sample value, so a sample page would be

"CR-123 My CR Title"

This would help by standardising page titles, and allowing users to follow a convention. When it comes to using things like the checklist macro - it would make things much easier there.
fields.summary: Allow Titles to be part of a Page Template

fields.description:
In IE 6, in rich text edit mode, user clicks insert link . The tabs for search, history, etc cover the search box.

I fixed it on mine by download the source for atlassian-tinymce-plugin and putting the following line at the top of this page and rebuilding and deploying,

atlassian-tinymce-plugin\tags\atlassian-tinymce-plugin-3.0-rc2\src\main\resources\wysiwyg-insertlink-popup.vm

add this line to top:
<!DOCTYPE HTML PUBLIC "-//W3C//DTD HTML 4.01 Transitional//EN" "http://www.w3.org/TR/html4/loose.dtd">

without it, there are problems with IE 6 usability. Please include this in next build of this plugin.

Contact me if you have any questions:


Ben Shoemate
Burleson Technology Group (BTG)
Web Architect
713-568-6507
ben.shoemate @t burlesontech.com
online at www.benshoemate.com

fields.description:
People ran into [problems|http://forums.atlassian.com/thread.jspa?forumID=101&threadID=29965] because we started invalidating the session on logout in 2.9.2. They expect certain session attributes like the seraph LOGGED_OUT_KEY to be present.

This means we need to remove all session attributes except some special attributes like the seraph ones. The other option would be to only remove critical attributes like the users history from the session and leave it untouched otherwise. But I would rather go for the first approach, and remove as much data from the session as possible to avoid privacy issue created by future code.
fields.summary: Session must not be invalidated on logout
